title: The Development of transportation
creator_credit: Electrical Research Products, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and ERPI Classroom Films
brief_description: A study of the development of transportation in the USA during the past 150 years. The spread of railway and highway networks over the geographical barriers of the continent, and the principle stages of the development of the locomotive and automobile engines are dealt within detail; air transport, and its potentialities form the final part of this survey.
